name: Farwell's Watermilfoil

Identifying Characteristics: Leaves: reddish, finely feather divided (1-3cm long), 5-12 leaflet pairs, radially scattered and whorled (3-5 leaves), internodal space <5mm
Flowers: midsummer, tiny, produced in leaf axils
Habitat: Prefer quiet waters of lakes and streams
Look Alikes: Other Leafy Watermilfoils, especially Low Watermilfoil
Range: Native Range: Maine, New England, northern portion of eastern United States

tags: plants with finely-divided leaves on stems
